summary: 3 different followers, each related to one another, are scattered from Falkreath, to Dawnstar, and Morthal to be in service of the Dragonborn.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=5][b][color=#ff0000][u]NOTICE[/u]:[/color][/b] [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80479/?]Dames of Skyrim Complete/Legendary[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80479/?][/url] has been uploaded and online.[/size]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/71778-0-1449373542.png[/img]

[b][color=#ff0000][size=6][u]FOREWORD[/u][/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]This is still a [b]Work-In-Progress[/b] version... ...sort of... ...since not all the females are modded. Updates and notices
will be posted when made available. For now, the only characters that aren't included in this mod are Khajiits,
Argonians, Orcs, and Elders. The good part about this mod is that it doesn't pose any trouble when updating as
opposed to followers/companions which requires to be dismissed before any update.

This is not a lore-friendly mod. The only intention of this mod is to change female NPC appearance and nothing
more. If you feel that this mod is not lore-friendly to your game, save yourself the trouble and [b]DO NOT INSTALL[/b]
this mod. Mods are created as how they are personally envisioned. I will not charge money for this mod.
All mods used to create this mod is/was created by respective mod creators mentioned in the description's credits
and in no way do I own them. All mods and tools have been used to create this mod is intended to change female
NPC appearances only as mentioned.[/size]



[b][color=#ff0000]

[size=6]DAMES OF SKYRIM Background[/size]

[/color][/b][size=3]Work's basically inspired by creator of [b][color=#ffff00][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40038/?]Bijin Warmaidens[/url][/color][/b] and [color=#ffff00][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63473/?]Bijin Wives[/url][/b][/color] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2650523/?]rxkx22[/url] (thanks for making the game look
and feel much better). The work done is extremely beautiful that I intentionally dodged modding those NPCs. As
well as [b][color=#ffff00][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59269/?]KS Hairdos Female NPC Overhaul[/url] [/color][/b]by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1975658/?]frostsmith[/url] which has the longest duration in my mods list (thanks for
sharing). The work they put in has undeniably made better looking NPCs far from the original vanilla look. But I've
been itching for the longest time, way before creating [b][color=#ffff00][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/66382?]Akavir Tsugumi[/url][/color][/b] which is also my other mod, to push this
project forward so I took the time to actually understand how to create/mod NPCs without changing any of the
default assets already done by [b][color=#ffff00][url=http://bethsoft.com/]Bethesda[/url][/color][/b] as much as possible. My utmost respect and gratitude to [color=#ffff00][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/7106389/?][b]Skylaskyrim[/b][/url][b]
[/b][/color]for the guidance from my previous mod (I'm still in love with Cael from [b][color=#ffff00][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57159/?]Sky Standalone Followers[/url][/color][/b]).

Change of appearances on female characters in [b]Winterhold[/b], [b]Windhelm[/b] (including Mixwater Mill and Darkwater
Crossing), [b]Riften[/b] (includes Sarethi Farm and Ivarstead), and [b]Falkreath [/b](includes Half-Moon Mill, Angi's Camp,
and Helgen - just before Alduin showed up).
[/size]


[color=#b6b6b6]Kissing Gilfre (who was the first to be modded). Using 0S3SEKSY NET 9000 by [b]Ceo to test for neck seams. It works as a tool as well.[/b]
[/color]

[color=#b6b6b6][size=2]Personally, I found it weird that Tormir's wearing Merchant clothing when she's a miner in Darkwater Crossing.[/size][/color]


[color=#ff0000][size=5][b][u]Samples of female NPCs that have gone through my modding[/u][/b][/size][/color]
[size=3]
So why don't I have a plethora of images of the NPCs? Well, for starters, I did a big overhaul on all the heads of
the previous release. Then I added 51 new heads. Not an easy feat in less than 3 weeks. But since I already spent
that time changing their appearances, I'd prefer that I leave it to you, mod users, to discover them from one hold to
another. Isn't that what adventurers do?
[/size]

[color=#b6b6b6]L-R: Nirya, Colette, Mirabelle Ervine, and Faralda[/color]


[color=#b6b6b6]Maven Black-Briar and Ingun Black-Briar[/color]


[color=#b6b6b6]Vex of The Thieves Guild from The Ragged Flagon in Riften[/color]


[color=#b6b6b6]Sapphire of The Thieves Guild in Riften[/color]


[color=#b6b6b6]Tonilia of The Thieves Guild in The Ragged Flagon at Riften[/color]


[color=#b6b6b6]Lynly Star-Sung of Vilemyr Inn at Ivarstead[/color]


[b][color=#ff0000][size=6]REQUIREMENTS:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Skyrim version 1.9
[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?]Caliente's Beautiful Bodies Edition by Caliente
 [b][/b][/url][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6709/?]DIMONIZED UNP female body by dimon99[/url][/b][/b][/size][b]

[/b]
[b][color=#ff0000][size=6]INSTALLATION:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Install with either Nexusmods Manager or Mod Organizer.

[b][color=#ff0000][size=6][u]FAQs[/u]:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Q: I installed CBBE. Do I need to install the UNP version too?
[/size]A: No. You install CBBE version for CBBE. UNP version for UNP.

[size=3]Q: I have SeveNBase in my game. How can I make use of the UNP version?
[/size]A: Copy the following files from your "\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\meshes\actors\character\character assets"

1stpersonfemalehands_0.nif (optional)
1stpersonfemalehands_1.nif (optional)
femalebody_0.nif
femalebody_1.nif
femalefeet_0.nif
femalefeet_1.nif
femalehands_0.nif
femalehands_1.nif

to "\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\meshes\avatar3s\SKW_Windhelm\Common".
Basically, the UVW mapping of UNP, UNPB, and SeveNBase share the same UV layout.

Q: Can I get these in individual installation?
A: No. You're just making things difficult.

Q: How come the eyes are red? Sometimes they're blue.
A: That's usually ENB causing it when NPC is outdoors. Put them indoors and their eyes are normal.
The only NPCs with eyes that are supposed to be red in Series 1.1 are Silda the Unseen,
Nilsine Shatter-Shield, Tova Shatter-Shield, Edda the Beggar, and Hefid the Deaf.

Q: Are the NPCs wearing the same set of clothes you have in your game?
A: No. Whatever clothing mod you have, it applies to that. In my case, it's Little Sexy Apparel Replacer.

Q: How come you mentioned HDT when the ones you uploaded don't have HDT.
A: Too much HDT all over the game makes the NPCs disappear OR not render at all.
Which is why I used non-HDT bodies for installation. Otherwise ppl will report
this as a bug when it really isn't.

Q: Are you going to combine them into one giant mod?
A: Nope. I always keep my work loose. Easier to fix stuff as well as modding them
according to preference.

Q: When are you planning to release Series 1 and 2 complete?
A: Working on the remaining NPCs for Series 2. Series 3 on the other hand needs re-work
entirely due to the adding of the Elder race. Have already started 2 NPCs each on
DoS Hearthfire, DoS Dawnguard, and DoS Dragonborn.

Q: Do you take requests?
A. No.[/size]


[b][color=#ff0000][size=6]UNINSTALL:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Uninstall whichever mod manager you are using, be it Nexusmods Manager or Mod Organizer.[/size]


[b][color=#ff0000][size=6]CREDITED TOOLS AND MODS USED DURING
CREATION PROCESS AND SCREENSHOTS:[/size]
[/color][/b]
[size=3]-[b][color=#1e84cc] [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29624/?]Racemenu 3.4.5 expired6978
[/url][/color][/b]- [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33526/?]ShowRaceMenu Precache Killer by kapaer
[/url][/b]- [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68311/?]KS Hairdos - Renewal by Kalilies Stealthic Khaos and Shocky
[/url][color=#1e84cc][/color][/b]- [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70834/?]Demoniac- High Quality Female Body Texture 8K 4K 2K by Regenbot03
[/url][/b]- [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30411/?]Brows by Hvergelmir
[/url][color=#1e84cc][/color][/b]- [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13722/?]The Eyes Of Beauty by Gabriel Mailhot as LogRaam
[/url][/b]- [/size][b][url=https://github.com/niftools/][size=3]NIF File Format Library and Tools by: alphasigmax, amorilia, neomonkeus, pacmorrowind[/size][/url][/b][b][url=https://loot.github.io/]
[/url][/b][b][color=#ff0000][size=6]

SPECIAL THANKS:[/size]

[/color][/b][size=3]- To my loving wife and wonderful kids who'd put up with me during late nights of modding.[/size]
[size=3]- To my relatives who finally gets the idea that I do this as a hobby (it's better than gambling).[/size]
[size=3]- Still, many many thanks to [/size][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/7106389/?]SkylaSkyrim[/url][color=#1e84cc][/color][/b][size=3] for the guidance.[/size]
[size=3]- For the creators of the mods I use: Major KUDOS! and much appreciation for making my Skyrim[/size]
[size=3]experience fun other than making it really sexy, of course. I mean who doesn't want their[/size]
[size=3]Skyrim to look sexy? Oh, wait. It's the... ...nevermind. XD[/size]
[size=3]- [/size][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65163/?][size=3]Forever Free logo mysticentity and The Creation Kids[/size]
[/url][color=#1e84cc][/color][/b][size=3]- [b][url=http://bethsoft.com]Bethesda[/url][color=#1e84cc][/color][/b] for a game that I can't let go (while I still wait for FO4's Creation Kit)[/size]
[size=3]- To friends who'd criticize and support my work through Facebook (you know who you are) - keep it coming![/size]
[size=3]- To [/size][b][color=#1e84cc][size=3]Juliane A. Irace[/size][/color][/b][size=3] (aka. Nocte Matrem) for allowing me to have her facial features for NPC Hermir in[/size]
[size=3]Winterhold (I told I'd put you somewhere in the game on Stormcloak side, as promised)[/size]
[size=3]- Creators of NIF Skope - thanks for making life easier when dealing with NPC's heads. YOU ROCK![/size]


[b][color=#ff0000][size=6]CHANGELOGS:[/size]
[/color][/b]
[size=3]- 02/05/16: Mod updated.
- 12/05/15: Initial upload.[/size]
